brief_summary.textblock: Study to accumulate post-market clinical evidence for the safety and effectiveness of the Sophono Alpha 2 and Alpha 2 MPO systems in subjects diagnosed with conductive hearing loss, single-sided deafness and mixed hearing loss who currently have or have had the Sophono implant.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the safety of the Sophono implant
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Implantation to Study Visit, up to 6 years
primary_outcome.description: The primary safety endpoint is the proportion of AEs related to the Sophono implant, which will be assessed through retrospective surgical chart review and prospective ENT exam.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the effectiveness of the Sophono Alpha 2 MPO processor
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint is the difference (gain) in the free-field pure tone audiometry assessed by pure tone average (PTA) unaided (AC) and aided (BC) by the Alpha 2 MPO processor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the effectiveness of the Sophono Alpha 2 processor to the Alpha 2 MPO processor
secondary_outcome.description: The difference in the free-field pure tone audiometry assessed by PTA aided by Alpha 2 processor compared to the PTA aided by Alpha 2 MPO processor

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the effectiveness of the Sophono Alpha 2 and the Sophono Alpha 2 MPO over time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Processor fitting to Study Visit, up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Change over time of PTA in the Sophono Alpha 2 and Alpha 2 MPO

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess subject satisfaction after system use
secondary_outcome.description: Subject satisfaction, via non-validated satisfaction questions
QOL assessment through validated Abbreviated Profile of Hearing Aid Benefit (APHAB)™ assessment

arm_group.description: Diagnosed with CHL, SSD and mixed HL who currently have or have had the Sophono implant

intervention.description: The Sophono Bone Conduction Hearing Systems are a family of sound processors and accessories that operate on the principle of BC of sound vibrations. The Sophono Bone Conduction Hearing Systems transmits audio vibrations through the skin into the bone where sound is sensed by the inner ear/cochlea. The Sophono Sound Processor is magnetically attracted to the Magnetic Implant and Magnetic Spacer. The Magnetic Implant, which is secured to the skull bone, affixes the Magnetic Spacer to the head transcutaneously through magnetic attraction forces, and the Sound Processor is magnetically affixed to the Magnetic Spacer. Vibration from the Sound Processor is transduced through the Magnetic Spacer to the Magnetic Implant and through the bone to the inner ear.

study_pop.textblock: The subject population for this study includes male and female patients 5 years of age and older who have received the Sophono implant. Subjects will be recruited from Investigators who have implanted Sophono systems or from other non-investigator physician referrals. Subjects are expected to represent a population diagnosed with conductive hearing loss (CHL), single-sided deafness (SSD), and mixed hearing loss (HL).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any subject who currently has or who has had the Sophono implant (including those who have been explanted)
- Has or has had Sophono implant for 3 months or longer
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has implant but is unable or unwilling to perform audiologic testing
- Subject is currently participating in another clinical study and has not been approved for concurrent enrollment by the Study Sponsor
